column5: Enjoyed reading your book. What a wonderful tribute you paid to your father by writing "A North Woods Fisherman's Story". Every time I cross Whitefish Bay I am sure I will be reminded of Al and his love for the lake.
Lazy, Thanks for your kind words. Dad was a special person and I am still reminded of his 60 year love affair with LOW on every trip I make to it! Bill
I try and do a solo trip every year after the family and/or all guys trip. Your book is a part of that journey every year. Thanks for sharing...
None of us can go wrong if we can have a 60 year love affair with a body of water. Mike Kansas

May 2011 will make 52 years of fishing Northern Ontario for me.My doctor/fishing partner told me I'll probably be able to make the trip for another ten years. On the down side, he told me that in January 2006. I caught the disease while catching 6# pike in Michigan 63 years ago and have been working on a cure ever since. Bill's book is on my shelf. I've bought several copies for fishing friends.
OK - where can we get the book?
